11.content: Who's comic series will we be following?
11.title: Marvel

1111.content:
It was just another day for your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man, as he went swinging from building to building, using his webs to propel himself across the city. He had already foiled a car-jacking, and had gotten some great photos of himself stopping the crime. Of course his boss wouldn't believe that he was doing the world any favors.

Spider-Man's secret identity was that of Peter Parker, the lovable loser with the super-hot supermodel wife, Mary Jane. His boss was J. Jonah Jameson, (JJJ,) owner of the Daily Bugle. JJJ didn't take kindly to Spider-Man's activities, and was trying to convince the world for years that Spider-Man was a menace. The only reason Parker still worked for the guy was because he gave the best pay for the pictures.

A million things went through Spider-Man's head as he swung from building to building. Was he getting to old for this? Was it really his job to save everyone? He thought back to the one time he refused to stop a thief, and it led to his Uncle Ben's death. "Never Again." he thought. He had learned from that experience that with 'great power came great responsibility.' A motto that his uncle told him over and over again. He made a mental note to visit Ben's widow, Aunt May later on today.

As he swung by the downtown region of New York, his ears heard a familiar ringing of a burglar alarm coming from one of the giant corporate buildings. "Well I am here anyways, I'd better check it out." Peter said to himself.

Spider-Man crawled on the building for get a glimpse of the situation. People were being evacuated, but he couldn't see from what. As he crawled up the building, he finally came across the reason for the commotion. Four men in advanced mechanical suits were in what looked to be a lab, carefully grabbing a vial from one of the freezers.

"Hey look boss, a freak." the smallest one said.
"Uh, that ain't no freak, that's ah Spiders-Man." said the tallest.
"So, blast him." said the boss.
Spiderman quickly crawled out of the was as what seemed to be a laser blaster was aimed at him. The glass flew down to the street below.
"Thanks for the opening. I'll be taking that gun from you." Spider-Man said as he shot artificial webbing from his suit, stuck it to the gun, and pulled it towards him.
"We's got what we wanted. Just go." the boss said, as the other three dashed through the door.
"No so fast, Iron-fan rejects." Spider-Man said as he caught the bosses back and dragged the crook towards him.
"Nots todays wall-crawler." the crook said as he took the vile and tossed it right towards Spider-Man. Spider-Man used his super-human reflexes to catch the vial, but his Superhuman strength crushed it and the fluid inside leaked through his suit onto his hands.

A stinging sensation overcame him, as the crook he caught used the time to eject from his suit and run after his men.
"What was in that vial?" Spider-Man asked as a dizziness overtook him.

There was no answer, as the man was already gone.

Spider-Man tried to get up, but his body felt like it was fighting itself.

"Freeze mutie scum!" a security guard said as he ran into the room.
"Oh, Now you do your job." Spider-Man tried to reply but all that came out was an incoherent mumble.

Aiming his right arm out the window, he shot a web at the skyscraper across the street, and pulled himself out of the room.
He was barely able to turn around before hitting the side of the building. Creating a noticable crack on one of the office windows.

"Sorry." he said as his grip loosened and he went falling down its side. Trying desperatly to stick onto the glass as he fell, he manages to slow himself down just enough to avoid breaking any bones as he hit the street.

The onlookers stared in amazement as one of New York's most famous vigilantes limped towards a small alley behind the two buildings.

So dizzy that he was barely able to stand straight. Spider-Man picked up a manhole cover, and crawled in. At least if he passed out in here, the cops wouldn't be as likely to find him.
1111.title: Meet Peter Parker a.k.a. Spider-Man

The tingling overtook his skull, and Peter shut his eyes as his body tried to fight the changes. The blackness beneath his eyelids became a red, followed by blue, consumed again by black.

The reflection before him was not that of Peter Parker, but one what looked like his twin sister. A hot lesbian, wearing her brothers clothes, with a curvier than average body. 11111211111212111121211.title: The Return to Status Quo

111112111112121111212111.content:
Weeks passed, and Peter was hopeful that Felicia had kept his secret. No one seemed to hang it over his head, and no one asked him any questions about it. But like anything in his life, good luck never lasted long.

In the Avengers tower, Peter Parker, as Spider-Man was having lunch before a meeting, eating Wheaties to keep up his strength. “Can I see you for a second?” Tony Stark said.

Tony Stark was the Avengers main funder, a playboy millionaire, who had developed an Iron suit and become one of the world’s most successful heroes. “Sure.” Peter replied as he walked towards Tony’s office.

“Peter, do you have a sister I should know about?” he asked.
“Why?”
“Carol Danvers complained that a fashion show was using her image. I told her it was for charity, but did a facial recognition scan. And do you know what I found?”
“Absolutely nothing of interest?” Peter quipped.
“I found that her face had a 95% match to yours. Sure the chin and nose are smaller, the lips are more luscious, but the ears, eyes, skull shape are incredibly similar. Thanks to Reed’s new ulta-definition cameras, we were able to scan her eyes, and the strangest thing happened.”
“I don’t want to know.”
“The eyes were a 95% match to our retinal scans of yours. That’s a similarity that twins have. But I looked in the database, and found that you don’t have a twin sister.”
“I’m just as surprised as you are Tony.”
“Yes, I can see that.” Tony ripped the picture of the girl in the Ms. Marvel uniform out of the camera. “I’m going to study this much more intimately tonight.”
“I don’t like the way he said intimately.” thought Peter.
“And don’t worry Pete, if I don’t find anything tonight, I’ll send my best men to track her down.”
“Thank you?” Peter said.
“If you have a twin sister, I’ll make sure you know about her. But if you remember her, give her this card. It’s my private number, and she looks like a good lay.”
“I think I’m going to be sick, again.” Peter thought.
“Is there anything else you want to get off your chest?”
“No Tony.”
“Then we’re done here. You can go back to eating breakfast.” Tony said, and Peter was sure he heard a chuckle as he left.

In the hallway, the clawed mutant known as Wolverine was posting pictures of the mysterious woman on the walls.
“Hey bub, at least they got yer good side.” he snickered.
“Aren’t you supposed to be dead you troll?” Peter yelled, and Wolverine continued to put up the pictures.

Parker slumped down defeated, someone figured it out. Now he could never show his face around here again.”

“Good morning…he…he…Parker,” Dr. Henry Pym giggled.
“Great now Ant-Man is mocking me!”

Peter sat back down at the table and sighed, a lot. His luck was never going to change. It was the curse of being Spider-Man. Although maybe if he could expose himself to the chemical again he could make some money from Stark...

Peter stopped his thinking. Thinking was dangerous. He went back to eating Wheaties.
111112111112121111212111.title: Epilogue

11133222.content: Everyone always goes for Spider-Man, Peter Parker, as a default character. Let's start to shake it up and put someone else in the spotlight:
11133222.title: Other Spiders?

111332221.content:
Okay, for one last time...

This is Miles Morales. Hero of New York, teenage student at Visions Academy, and the latest in a number of Spider-Men. After a vicious attack, the original Spider-Man, Peter Parker, died in combat against vengeful villains. Miles believed in his heart that if he had been brave enough to take up the mantle, he could have saved Peter's life. There were some growing pains and more tragedy ahead of him... but soon he grew into mantle. He worked hard in school, he made his parents proud, and he did what he could to make the world a better place.

And yet, one more change was ahead of him in the days to come.
111332221.title: Spider-Man (Miles Morales)

1113322211.content: What could be causing the change?
1113322211.title: Gender Swap

choices: He becomes more like another Spider-Girl
111332221131.content:
All things considered, Miles was feeling pretty good. He had a hell of a busy week, what with gaining Spider- powers, meeting several different Spider-Man, and every other emotionally taxing event that had occurred since his arrival onto the spider scene. But now, things had finally settled down and the world was at relative peace. He was finally fitting in at school and making friends, his spider patrols were progressing nicely, and the people of New York were warming up to him.

Still, something was bugging him, his spider-sense itching at the back of his mind. He had come into the role of Spider-Man naturally at last and yet being so close to the machine that brought universes together... it made him feel weird.

Little did Miles know that his proximity to the super-collider was altering the very reality around him. The universe recognized too much of other universes in him and was struggling to understand how to make him fit inside itself.

Slowly, but surely, it was going to make him fit.
111332221131.title: Complications from super-collider (Spider-Verse)

1113322211311.content:
The alarm went off far too early for his liking. Groaning, he rolled over to pound on his phone to make the infernal beeping cease. But stopping the noise wouldn't stop the march of time and he had to reluctantly push himself off of the bed.

Miles stretched his arms wide, dreading the start of the new day. Patrols had taken up a lot of time last night and he was nowhere near prepared for his math exam. No use putting it off, however, and he quickly went to work on getting on his clothes.

Huh. With the arrival of Spider-powers, he had to get his uniform refitted. Yet it seemed like this uniform size was now too big. I must have overestimated the growth spurt...

Brushing aside these thoughts, Miles quickly went to work gathering his things together. Yet a few other things seemed odd. His hair seemed a little longer than usual, curls trailing down his neck a few inches. His body hair, or what little h had, had vanished in comparison. Reaching between his roommate and the desk to get to his backpack didn't take as much effort as he remembered. Had his arm slimmed down?

With all the changes coming with Spider-Man, Miles supposed things like this would just be explained in their own time. Did Spiders even have body hair? He wasn't entirely sure. He just knew he had classes and Spider-work to complete before heading back home for the weekend. Just one more day befofe he could enjoy a little relaxation.

Confident that things would settle, Miles ventured out into the academy to continue his day.
1113322211311.title: Girl version of himself

11133222113112.content:
There was something even more different about today that Miles couldn't quite put down. His spider-sense was "handy" enough to let him know when eyes were on him, which did just wonders for his anxieties. And today, it seemed to be telling him that people were looking at him... differently. It didn't seem to be attraction or awe (or at least not yet). But there was definitely something off. His roommate Ganke was oddly less comfortable talking about his comics than he was before. His classmate Judge, who he had gotten along with fairly well so far, gave him a few puzzled looks before seeming to accept him once again. It was a disconcerting change.

One thing he noticed was the newfound ease at which girls approached him. He wasn't exactly Mr. Unpopular but he wasn't despised or anything either. Still, he wasn't expecting to be approached by two girls from his class. He recognized one at least: Barbara Rodriguez. Full of about as many sarcastic quips as Spider-Man, but on a more musical career path.

She leaned on the lunch table, fixing Miles with a serious look. "Miles, you can settle a bet for us, right?" She gestured to her friend. "Becca says she'd fuck Daredevil, marry Luke Cage, kill Spider-Man. I say fuck Luke Cage, marry Spider-Man, kill Daredevil."

Becca lifted up her hands defensively. "I just think Luke Cage would be a good husband! He's got that gentle giant thing going!"

Barbara waved her off dismissively. "Where are you on this?"

Miles didn't know how to react. "You're asking me?"

"Uh, yeah, obviously."

"That's... why do you think I'd know?" He didn't think he was smooth with the ladies, but he didn't expect question like this.

Barbara rolled her eyes. "You're harmless so-"

"Is that a compliment?" He wasn't sure how he felt about that.

"You should take it as one. You've got a... trustworthy aura."

"What does that mean?" Although he found that much easier to accept. Trustworthy felt like natural Spider-Man charm.

"Just answer the question, hon."

Miles pinched the bridge of his nose. "I dunno, fuck Spider-Man, marry Luke Cage, kill Daredevil?"

The two girls groaned. "You were supposed to be our tie-breaker!"

"That'll show us. Hey, if you're at the mall this weekend, text us. We can hang."

He had to force himself not to look too pleased with that. "Uh- yeah! Sure!"

The girls waved to him casually as they left. He waved to them awkwardly.

High school was a weird time. Luckily, the day would end quickly. The teacher didn't seem to call on him as much and the only other thing bothering him was the way boys seemed to be casually looking over in his direction before catching themselves. What were they expecting to see...?

Finally, after a cheerful walk downtown, he could return home. But even that seemed different from usual.

"Nobody's been bothering you at school, right?"

Miles had to double take at his father. "Yeah, its been fine."

Jefferson's face was fixed in a stern look. "No troublemakers? Because I can cause them some trouble if they're giving you any."

"Dad, really, its been going great." Mr. Morales hadn't exactly been an unprotective father, but he tended to have a "stick with it" philosophy to things. Now, he seemed pretty nervous about his son being off in the world.

After all the weirdness of the day, Miles was really looking forward to busting up some crime.
11133222113112.title: Social changes

111332221131121.content:
Swinging through the streets gave Miles just the amount of air he needed. He busted up some muggings, a gas station robbery or two, and generally helped settle the petty crimes of the city.

Yet the back of his mind returned to the words of Barbara Rodriguez. "Harmless" she called him. That still prickled at him. How should he feel about that? It sounded like a compliment but it also felt like a weird way to describe a person just generally.

It bothered him so much, he found himself pausing to look himself over in mirrors. Was there something wrong with him? He couldn't deny that he was slimmer than usual. In fact, looking at the whole picture, there was an almost shapely quality to his hips and pecs that didn't exist before. Could that be the problem?

Or maybe, spoke a new thought in Miles' mind. The problem is you aren't shapely enough.

It was an unfamiliar concern, but teenage anxieties quickly took a grip onto the idea. That was it, wasn't it? He was too gangly, too thin. He just wasn't attractive enough for anyone to take notice of him. Barbara didn't consider him a threat, and Ganke and Judge clearly considered him a nuisance. He was just an ugly, gawky, little weasel.

Fears about his appearance wrapped around Miles' mind, needling him with new anxieties over hair and body and weight and all the reasons he was undateable. By the end of the night, he just wanted to cuddle up to a pillow and try to sleep away his fears. He couldn't think of any way he could wipe away these newfound paranoias. Maybe there was an expert for things like this.
111332221131121.title: Mental Changes During Spider-Patrol

choices: Miles leans towards a girly, preppy style
Miles goes for a punk, rebellious style
1113322211311211.content:
Miles stumbled out of bed late the next day. Long hours patrolling the streets of New York took a number out on him. He couldn't help but treasure what sleep he could get.

As he shuffled into his clothes, he couldn't help but look himself over in the mirror. Maybe the costume made it look like he had extra weight. Somehow, he looked even slimmer than before. His hair was certainly growing longer and curlier at a faster pace than usual. His face softer, lips fuller. What was a decent amount of muscle had shifted into a small chest that his brain wasn't ready to recognize as what it was.

Instead, his brain focused on the negative. His clothes were definitely too big for him now. Images of girls whispering behind his back, gossiping about his lack of taste, haunted his mind. He quickly fired a text off in Barbara's direction. He needed something more fashionable.

It wasn't until he met with the girls that he began to wonder if something was wrong with him. While there had been an enjoyable amount of laughing and gossiping over snacks (which he wasn't quite used to but couldn't help getting invested in), it was the actual shopping that got to him. The girls were all shopping for things he had no interest in! Perfume, lipstick, even bras.... This wasn't what he signed up for.

Even stranger was how quickly the girls seemed to accept his presence without the blink of an eye. They even dragged him into the girl's clothing section to get something for him.

"C'mon, Miles, you never get anything for yourself when we go out!" Barbara huffed.

"I've never gone out with you guys before."

"Exactly my point! You need to treat yourself." She pulled a flowery dress from the rack and pressed it against his chest. "This could look great on you!"

He stumbled back, a retreat blocked by one of the others. "Guys! These aren't... my kinda thing!"

Barbara crossed her arms. "Well, you aren't leaving until we find you something that is your thing!"

"Are you serious?"

"Well...." Becca placed a hand on Miles' shoulder. "You've been kinda stressed since you arrived at Visions. Wouldn't it be good to do something nice for yourself?"

...They made a compelling point. With everything else going on in his life, he hadn't had much time for himself. Maybe it was time for him to do something for himself.

"...alright, alright, I'll try something on, if it'll make you happy."

"It would."

Groaning, he quickly took his pick off the rack and escaped into the changing room.
1113322211311211.title: Mall with girls

1113322211312.content:
'Coasting' wasn't really the verb Miles would ever have associated with Spider-Man.

But, a couple of weeks after quite literally saving the world, that's what he was doing. School and Spider-activities both got a little easier, with the right help:May Parker generously provided some of Peter's old journals, aiding his patrol circuits immensely; Supervillains had been lying low ever since Fisk had been arrested; and with his roommate, Ganke's help, he was able to catch up on the work he missed (and get some quipping advice.)

Yup, everything was pretty good.

But despite the stability of Miles' life, the source of his powers wasn't. The fabric of dimensions was a tricky thing: it liked to keep everything in its place. When the Supercollider had fired before, the strings of the multiverse were inextricably close.

Close enough to bring about a veritable army of Spider-People.

Close enough to give Wilson Fisk hope for a second chance.

Close enough to give Miles Morales his powers.

You see, the spider that bit Miles was an interdimensional tourist itself. It had escaped the Collider's chambers during a more inconsequential test involving household furniture and made its way to the unwitting Miles.

The bite spliced his DNA with a dimensionally displaced creature, something that normally has the consequence of rapid cell death. But Miles fits a 'niche' in his own universe. A Spider-Person shaped niche.

That being said, the unique situation of Miles isn't quite 'recognized,' so to speak. He doesn't quite fit. But the multiverse knows what other Spider-People look like. And it has its ways of making things fit.

Which Earth did the spider come from?
1113322211312.title: He becomes more like another Spider-Girl

1123.title: Body swap

113.content:
The Averagers were spending a relaxing day in Stark Tower after spending the last several days searching for hidden Hydra agents within world governments. And Nick Furry had decided that they had earned themselves a few days rest. But unknown to the team Loki, Thor's trickster brother, had snuck away from his prison cell on Asgard and was hidden away in the tower. And he had himself a plan to mess around with The Avengers without actually doing any physical harm to them.

Now the question is, what is this master of magic planning?
113.title: Avengers

choices: Alter both of their minds and bodies
1131.content:
By altering their bodies, the Avengers would be caught off guard. In bodies they couldn't understand and would have trouble adjusting to, the God of Mischief had all the advantages.

Even better, if he played his cards right, he might be able to alter their minds as well as their bodies! Ooooh, what a delightful scheme he had planned! He couldn't wait to see what might result from his magical spell.
1131.title: Gender Swap the whole team

choices: Ordinary gender swap, they think their new bodies are normal
11313.content:
Yes, yes! Why settle for one change when he could have his cake and eat it too!

Laughing to himself, the God of Mischief observed the Avengers relaxing throughout their base. Hiding in the shadows. They had no idea how quickly their ordinary lives were about to wildly move outside their control!

His staff glowed as it spun through the air, washing the Avengers Mansion in a blue aura. In various rooms of the house, the superheroes began to feel slightly peculiar, although they struggled to explain why...
11313.title: Alter both of their minds and bodies

choices: The Avengers are transformed into teenagers as well
113132.content:
The more Loki thought about his hysterical scheme, the more he realized the opportunity that had been presented to him. Why let the heroes continue their heroics unabated when he could have so much more fun with them? He could entertain himself for years before anyone caught on! No one could stop him!

And so, with magic on his lips, his words weaved into the minds of the Avengers, slowly changing fact after fact along with each of trait of their bodies. Mind and matter became equally malleable at the hands of the devious Loki.
113132.title: More complicated alterations

1131321.content:
Tony Stark, billionaire, playboy, philanthropist, and the man with a metal supersuit, felt off. He was spending the day in his lab, constantly working and studying, hoping to advance his armor to heights never seen before. And yet he kept getting distracted by all these little things.

First, his hair kept getting in the way. He couldn't believe he forgot to wear a hair tie in the middle of using a blow torch. This was science 101. He quickly tied his hair in a suitable ponytail before attempting to return to his work.

Later, he couldn't help but notice a pain in his chest. At first he thought something might be wrong with his arc reactor, until he realized he had forgotten to put on a bra today. It took a few minutes to retrieve it from his room and even longer than usual to latch it together. What was his deal today? He was a super genius, not some kind of ditz.

Finally, when he tried to return to his work, he struggled to motivate himself. What was the point of working this hard? It wasn't like he was being graded on it. And there were so many other ways to spend his time. He could go to the mall, get some new threads, turn heads with a little strut here and there...

Did that sound right? He rested a hand on his smooth, hairless face. He couldn't help but sense that something was horribly wrong, but he struggled to put his finger on it.
1131321.title: The Avengers are transformed into teenagers

11313211.content:
Tony rolled over the mirror, taking stock of himself. A young girl, about the age of sixteen or seventeen looked back at him. He smiled. She smiled back

The girl had long, brown hair that was perfectly maintained, luxurious and full of waves. Her face had been applied with just the right amount of make-up, nothing to seem too desperate or too careless. Enough that boys wouldn't even realize she was wearing make-up at all. Her body was curvy, apparent even in the man's t-shirt and jeans she was wearing, with legs that welcomed any hormonal teen. The faint glow of the arc reactor was still apparent, but it seemed to bring boys' attention to her generous cleavage.

Toni Stark dragged a hand through her hair and smiled at her reflection. How could anything be wrong when you were built like she was?

Leaving the workshop and returning to her room, Toni quickly changed into something more appropriate for a day on the town. A nice dress that showed off just enough skin for the other juniors that might be at the mall today. With a purse and a credit card in hand, she strolled out of what was quickly becoming a dorm room rather than a mansion.
11313211.title: "Toni" falls under the spell entirely

113132111.content:
"God, I love being me!" Toni sighed as she walked across the campus, heading for the parking lot. She pulled up her phone and began snapping selfies, enraptured by her own glorious perfection. The former male billionaire picked the best ones and quickly uploaded them to Instagram for her followers to enjoy. And boy did she have followers. As an heiress to a massive, almost unending fortune she had influence, but using it for anything other than furthering her popularity and social status meant nothing to her.Toni lived for likes and views of social media as, to her, those were all that mattered. Sure, a lot of them were just sad guys whacking off to her, but she couldn't control that. It actually made her feel even better, knowing that she was desired, even by people she considered absolute losers.

Toni reached the park and glanced around and sighed with annoyance before tapping her phone a couple of times. She held it up to her diamond studded ears as the ringtone droned on and one before a male answered on the far end.

"Yes, Ms. Stark?" Happy Hogan replied. He sounded out of breath.

"Happy, I have been standing here in the parking lot for three minutes! Where are you?" Toni barked to her bodyguard. He'd only been hired a few months ago, part of a 'protection plan' that her handler/agent/employeemom Pepper Potts had drummed up with help from her Uncle Obadiah after a prankster had goosed her at a social event. And not that Obadiah Stane was actually her uncle, but he had been running the weapons company her father had built since her mother and father were killed in a car accident when she was very young. Toni was pretty sure that she loved him like a father, but then again, she was pretty sure she'd love anyone that doted on her the same way he did. And Toni was pretty sure he was dating Pepper. Not that Pepper Potts was bad...She was a good agent but sometimes she was just SO overbearing and protective. Toni was sixteen! She was allowed to have her independence!

"Sorry Ms. Stark! I had to chase away the paparrazi! I'll be there in a minute!" Came his reply.

"You better be, or I'll find someone else! Like that Natalie Rushman! Then I'd have a bodyguard with some fashion sense!" Toni's voice was bratty, hateful. But she meant every word. While Happy seemed nice enough, it was just weird having to hang out with an older guy all the time. She tapped her designer sandal'd foot impatiently, unaware that the Arc reactor in her chest slowly shifted and parted, turning into a glowing blue crystal necklace and matching ear rings.

But true to his word, Happy was there in the lavish sports car that Toni was pretty sure she owned, and she climbed inside.

"Finally! All right Happy, take me into the city! I want to visit Maria Hill's before it closes!" Toni's favorite store was Maria Hill's, who in this new reality created by Loki, was now a top fashion designer with her own stores all of the globe.

"Yes Ms. Stark!" Happy replied, stepping on the gas as the sports car roared out of the parking lot.
113132111.title: Toni Stark

choices: Bah! You'll find someone at the mall to mess around with
1131321111.content:
Toni primped her hair in the camera of her phone, parting it so it looked just right. Her make-up wasn't looking quite right either and that would. Not. Stand. A bit of extra gloss here, some detail there...

She pouted as a final check before smirking pridefully. "There. Now I look just so totally perfect."

"Always do, Ms. Stark!" Happy chirped from the front.

Ugh. "Don't make it weird, Happy."

"Right, miss, sorry miss."

She rolled her eyes, shifting her gaze to her phone. Being around this old fuddy duddy was a real cramp on her style. She needed someone to bring the fun to this increasingly lame outing. Maybe she should text Rhodey or Banner to join her. Rhodey was always just the right amount of rebellious and fun without overshadowing her own natural talents and beauty. And little mousy Bryce Banner was the perfect doormat to make herself pop in comparison.

On the other hand, maybe what she really needed was a nice little toy to play with. Some striking young lad who had the looks and charm to not make her look like she was settling. Which she always would be, of course, but the illusion of letting a boy think they were on her level was always fun. That Russian boy was always a treat- Nate something? Ooooh or maybe that edgy little Maximoff. That would really embarrass Potts. And she loooooved to embarrass Potts.

Decisions, decisions...
1131321111.title: Continue to follow Toni.

choices: Eve is on a sports team
113132112.content:
Steve Rogers, a man out of time and a hero to the American people, felt strange, although he struggled to pin down why. He was spending his day in the training room, beating a punching bag into submission. Normally, bags would be flying across the room if he wasn't careful. Today, it took effort to push it even a few inches. It was almost like his superstrength was vanishing.

He moved to the treadmill, looking for something more endurance based. As he ran, his hair and body bounced at increasingly unfamiliar ways.

"Did I put on a sports bra today?" he wondered to himself. As if to answer him, he felt a support on his chest. Of course he did, he never forgot something so important.

Eventually leaving the treadmill, Steve focused on his stretches. Flexibility and endurance were vital to his day-to-day work. He couldn't let down his team by falling behind.

In the mirror, a blonde girl was drenched with sweat. She seemed to have everything going for her. She was attractive, athletic, kind, and generous. She was everything any girl at school wanted to be.

Eve frowned at these kinds of thoughts. Did she really have such a big ego? True, she was strong and athletic, but she wasn't sure if she thought of herself in such flattering terms. She just wanted to support her school, in any way she could. It was full of such wonderful people. It was her duty to make sure every student, whether on her team or otherwise, felt welcome.
113132112.title: Follow another Avenger

1131321122.content:
Eve wrapped up her time in the training room with a quick run thing of the single-person cheers. She had every routine memorized, but keeping practice was essential. The school deserved a rehearsed, perfect cheer for all its amazing students and staff. It was the patriotic thing to do.

With her routine complete, Eve made her way through the hall of the mansion dorms. With her work-out complete, she still had so much to do! As Captain of the cheer squad, she needed to make sure everyone knew which events they were cheering for. The student council might need help fund-raising other clubs; she had to make sure there was at least one cheerleader ready to lead a helping hand. And that was on top of studying for school, attending after-school charities, and keeping an eye out for any students that looked like they needed someone to talk to.

There was so much to do, she didn't have time to think about anything else.

Distracted with her mental to-do-list, Eve didn't notice the large man in the halls until they bumped shoulders.

"Oh, sorry!" she apologized immediately.

"Tis unnecessary, miss..." Thor trailed off, staring at the girl curiously. Eve was already several feet away, mind wrapped in thoughts of practice and bake sales.

"Miss!" He shouted after her, startling her out of her reverie. "How... What are you doing in this place?"

Eve blinked, tilting her head curiously. "Heading to my computer to see if the student council has any new projects for us, mostly."

How is this possible?, Thor wondered in amazement. Stark has metal guards surrounding the mansion on 24 hour surveillance! How could a Midgardian child such as this bypass his security?

"But how did you enter our domain?"

Eve frowned slightly, parsing his words. How...? Oh! She smiled a bright smile. "You mean the code to the training room? Its in your student handbook, page 34!"

Now it was Thor's turn to blink in confusion. "Student... handbook?"

She laughed lightly. "In your dorm! Every student got one. If you lost yours, you should head to the main school and ask for a spare copy!" She checked her watch. "Sorry Thor, I gotta go- just don't be so ditzy you walk into the girl's changing rooms again!"

And before Thor could protest, Eve had vanished around the corner. A captain's work was never done.
1131321122.title: "Eve" Rogers is a cheerleader

11313211222.content:
Something was terribly wrong in the Avengers Mansion and Thor had to figure out what.

The trouble was, it was so difficult to spot all the clues. Signs that should be obvious required immense mental strength to fully comprehend. It took three loops around the second floor before the God of Thunder realized that several rooms had disappeared or been replaced. What had once been a conference room was now a lounge with couches and a TV. When he looked out the window, it seemed to him that the Mansion had been split into two buildings. Tis almost like some sort of private Midgardian campus? But how can this be...?

Yet despite what his heart and memories told him, his mind seemed to remain unusually calm. This is all perfectly normal. The mansion was always like this. One building for dorms, the other for work. No need to trouble yourself.

Perhaps the most startling change was when he briefly stopped near the room of Hank Pym and Janet Van Dyne, the heroes known as Ant-Man and the Wasp. The former was wrapped in the middle of his scientific experiments, working on building some sort of mechanical device. His hair was disheveled and he had let some stubble grow on his cheeks. The latter was relaxing in a chair, reading a fashion magazine. Janet was perhaps, in Thor's experience, the most fashionable human he had met on Midgard.

"Friend Pym, hast thou noticed unusual changes recently?"

"Hm? Oh, definitely Thor."

Thor grinned. Excellent! Perhaps he was getting somewhere.

"My latest experiment with the Pym particles has had a surprising chemical reaction to-"

Of course.

"What's troubling you, blondie?" Ah, Janet. Always with the good humor.

"Something appears amiss. I struggle to define what is troubling me, but rest assured, I will track it down to its source!"

"Well, if we see anything out of the ordinary, we'll be right there to kick some baddy butt."

The two shared a laugh. "I shall save some villains for your fists, compatriot."

Thor once again circled the building, trying to find the mystery that was ailing him. It was on the tip of his tongue, yet his brain couldn't quite make the mental leap.

Suddenly, a cry from the dorms! The God raced to the room of Pym, ready to catch the villain in the act. "Halt your assault, knave, or face the hammer of the Mighty Thor!"

"Thank you, Thor!" A teenage girl with blonde hair was shoving away a brown-haired boy, looking incredibly annoyed. "Would you drag John somewhere he can't bother me? Some of us are trying to complete homework!"

This was not a villainous assault.

"C'moooon," whined the boy named John. "You've been studying for hours, Hannah! Can't your particle whatsit theories stay on hold for a few hours? We could go to a park or a b-ball court-" He paused to flex demonstratively. "And I could show you my moves~"

"Hannah" rolled her eyes. "If I'm going to do well at the science fair in a few months, I need complete concentration. Take Hulk if you need company so bad."

John flopped into the chair grumpily, pushing aside a sports magazine. "Back me up, Thor. Prissy Pym here can't stay cooped up indoors forever!"

Thor considered himself a fighter of great prowess, with quick instincts and a keen mind. Yet all he could do now was stare, mouth flopping like a fish. "I... apologize, I am afraid I might be in the wrong room. Where are my fellow warriors? Hank and Janet were here a second ago?"

John snorted. "Smooth cover."

Hannah looked slightly more concerned than her fellow teen. "You... feeling alright?"

They recognized him, just like the girl in the halls... But they were but Midgardian youths! How was it possible? He gripped his forehead in bafflement.

"Your name... is Hannah Pym?"

"...Since I was born, yes."

"But... you are not Ant-Man."

Now John looked concerned. "D'you hit your head, bud? D-do you need to go to the nurse or something?"

Thor backed away slowly. "Ah... No assistance necessary, strange youths. I shall relocate myself elsewhere."

The two teens glanced at each in mild alarm as Thor quickly escaped from the room. Mansion changing, heroes changing, everything changing. Yet somehow similar?

What sorcery was this?!
11313211222.title: Ant-Man and Wasp change

choices: Thor Oddindottir, athletic foreign exchange student
113132112221.content:
He had to find a way out. If he could escape this mysterious spell, find aid outside the mansion, perhaps he could end this foul scheme against the Avengers!

Thor could feel the dorms playing tricks on him. Moving the stairs to the opposite end of the floor, changing hallways when his back was turned, reinforcing windows when he attempted to hammer his way through... But finally, he managed to reach the front of the building. Only a few more steps and he could return with-

"Leaving so soon, brother?"

He spun quickly. Loki, God of Mischief and Lies, grinned wickedly from the couch. "I must say, mortals really must update their waiting room magazines. This copy of People is at least three months old."

"Loki." Thor growled. "What sort of witchcraft have you cast this time?"

The frost giant smirked, rising from his seat. "A few parlor tricks, advanced to levels never seen before by anyone of the Nine Realms. A few illusions there, a body shift spell there, memory alterations here and there... Simple on their own, but with an enchanted ring circled around your mansion, I have lifted its potential to new heights."

"End your spell, brother, before I find where you truly have hidden yourself."

Loki laughed in surprise. "Finally caught on to one of my basic tricks then? Yes, I won't be entering your base without magical protection over myself. Anyone that enters the magical circle will change as your friends have. The school is always accepting new students."

Thus capturing any other heroes, Avengers or otherwise, under Loki's spell. Damn. "Your spell has not dominated I, brother. Once I leave through these doors, I shall find you post-haste."

The mischief maker raised a solitary eyebrow. "Those doors?"

"Yes brother, those-" The doors were gone and Thor was facing a brick wall. On the second floor again.

"You didn't really think I'd let you get that close to exit, did you?"

"Brother, end this madness once and for all!"

A villainous grin overtook Loki's face. "Yes.... perhaps you are right. Watching you run in circles and panic at the changes to the patriot and the insects has been amusing, but I think its time you see what identity I've crafted for you."

Thor's eyes widened in horror. "You would not dare!"

"It took a long time to decide. Deviating too much from your original personality might stretch the power of spell, giving you an inkling of what's happened to you... but that sounds amusing too, doesn't it? Aware of what I've done, but struggling to fight it for a little longer? They're both tempting options in their own way."

He waved his staff melodramatically and Thor felt the changes overtake him. His height and build shrunk immensely, his hair lengthened, his entire body shifted and changed to fit the new identity created for him. He could feel the fog overtake his mind, trying to destroy every bit of himself. He had to resist! He was the Mighty Thor! He had fought giants, demons, and Midgardian creations of all kinds. He could beat his brother's villainous magic! He was the Mighty Thor! He was....
113132112221.title: Continue following Thor

Other heroes try to enter the mansions to save the Avengers
1131321122211.content:
"Thor! There you are!"

Thor felt a hand on her shoulder. Startled, she turned to find T'Challa, her roommate, looking at her in concern. The two had a close bond, both foreign exchange students in an unfamiliar country, heirs to wealthy homes, and a habit of speaking quite formally.

That... sounded right. Didn't it?

"Is everything alright? Hannah and John said you were acting strange."

Strange? Her? Thor brushed her hair out from under her blue jacket and silver-dotted tank top. Yes, she supposed something did feel off today. She just had trouble defining it. What was it...

"There is no need for concern, my friend. I was troubled by a mere headache, nothing more." She blinked at the sound of her voice. Was it always that light and high-pitched...? Of course it was. What else could it sound like?

T'Challa sighed in relief. "That is good to hear." A smirk rose on her lips. "I had a feeling John was trying to show Hannah how considerate he was by creating problems."

Thor laughed in surprise. "I thought rumor was below you, T'Challa!"

"Rumor is based on suspicion. A keen observer can tell when a man is trying to impress with no trouble." She frowned slightly. "But Thor, I told you that name in confidence. Remember: my father has me under the name "Lucy Charles" to avoid any discovery from his business rivals hoping to embarrass us."

Thor felt another moment of confusion. Since when had T'Challa required a fake name... But the answer came quickly. As a future princess of that country Wakanda, of course T'Challa wanted to remain under the radar while she received her education. How could she have forgotten? Thor's own father was a politician in Sweden, so she understood the desire for secrecy.

"Apologies, my friend. I was behaving, as John and Toni might say, like a ditz."

Snort. "I wouldn't go that far. I know I can trust another foreigner in America, especially one as loyal as you."

The two girls walked off together, discussing various classes and events present in their daily lives. Neither of them heard the fiendish cackling of an Asgardian.
1131321122211.title: Thor Odindottir

1131321122212.content:
....in the library.

Donna looked around in confusion. She could've sworn just a moment ago she was in the hallway. Yet here she was now, in front of a pile of textbooks. That made sense, at least. If she was going to get a medical degree, she needed to study as much as possible.

...Did she? Something about that seemed wrong somehow. Shouldn't she be doing something much more active than that?

She stood up quickly, only to feel a sharp pain in her leg. She straightened her glasses and looked down. Of course. Being active wasn't really an option for her. After an injury in elementary school, Donna needed a leg guard and a cane to walk around. Even now, it hurt to move too quickly or to exert herself beyond her means.

But something about that felt wrong too. She brushed her fingers through her short, dirty blonde hair which only went as far as her chin. She briefly wondered if she should let it grow out, but it seemed like such a hassle...

Something still didn't feel right. But what could it be? If she just focused, carefully forcing past this feeling of unease....
1131321122212.title: Donna Blake, shy bookworm

11313211222121.content:
An image of a hammer appeared in her mind. Strong and steel, much too big for someone as small as her. Or was it?

Donna found her feet carrying her to the school computer, quickly typing "hammer" into the library's search engine. Pages of hardware and engineering books that would be more interesting to the likes of Toni nearly exhausted Donna's patience until she paused on one entry.

Mythical Weapons.

On a mission of mystery, Donna walked to the appropriate section and pulled the book from the shelf. She flipped through pages until finally, at last, the image of Mjolner was proudly displayed in the middle of the colorful book.

A rush of familiarity overtook Donna and she had to lean against the shelf to stop herself from falling over. She eyes skimmed through the text, looking through anything of use.

Norse myths... only the worthy... wielded by Thor, God of Thunder...

She slammed the book shut, breathing in terror. Why? Why was she so scared of what she'd find? What was wrong with her?

Her hands drifted along the shelves, feeling the binds of every book. Eventually, it stopped on a big, sparkling cover with the label "Norse Mythology and You."

Before she could stop herself, she was back at the table, pouring over every legend and tale and myth she could find. Tales of heroic battles, astounding tricks, incredible feats, and faraway lands. And with each word she read, it all became crystal clear.

She was Thor Odinson. God of Thunder.

Her mind screamed that she was going insane, she was just a girl, everything was normal everything was normal everything was normal. But she could not deny the increasing confidence in these stories and the memories they stirred.

'A scheme by Loki then,' she thought to herself. 'If my memories are real, Odin once turned Thor into an ordinary doctor named Donald Blake in order to humble him. Only after Donald proved himself could Thor's memory and identity be returned to him. Loki must have made me, Donna Blake, as a reminder of Thor's original failure to live up to his father and his hammer.'

She wasn't sure how she felt about that. She was still Donna, even if she was also Thor. She didn't like to think of herself as an insult. Nonetheless, Loki was messing with the minds of mortals. As a doctor in training, she couldn't let that happen. Even if it might lead to the end of her existence.

But how? Even with this knowledge, the idea of confronting anyone or even speaking over a quiet whisper seemed terrifying. Loki had made sure her confidence was shot to hell and back.

There were only two things that could help her now. She either had to find Mjolner and regain the powers of Thor or she had to find a way to convince one of the other students that she had been changed. That maybe all of them had been changed.

The legendary Merc with the Mouth, the nuisance of heroes and villains alike, and currently an Avenger: the one and only Deadpool. Wade Wilson strolled through the halls of the Avengers Mansion, whistling cheery pop music to himself.

"My milkshake brings all the boys to the hard and damn right, it's better than yours, damn right it's-"

He glanced up suddenly, hand already on his blade. He could sense something. Something close by. Something that was a threat.

He peeked around the corner, trying to gauge the situation. He could feel it just on the edge of his perception, something he could spot if he just tapped into his most heightened of senses.

A grin suddenly spawned under his mask.

"Oh there, you are."

He leaned against the wall, staring off into the distance. He pulled out a blade, checking the sharpness, preparing for whatever attack he may need to-

"Yeah, yeah, cut it with the descriptions, alright? No need to get so damn flowery. We're just gonna have a chat.

I'm sure you know me. Hundreds of comics, two blockbuster hit films, a decent video game, crossovers out the whazoo! The Deadpool. I'm so iconic, I don't need need an adjective before my titles! I mean, they have that whole "Despicable Deadpool" comic, but that only lasted for a year.

Purely written format, huh? Choose your own adventure kinda thing? That's neat! I had a comic along those lines too, good stuff, everyone loves audience participation. Oooh, oooh! Let me test something real quick. Oh that's FUN. Not quite the same as the speech bubbles. Kinda hard to read even. Pretty icky actually! You wanna hear me talk, so we better stick with what's readable.

Sooooooo what's the sitch? Doing some kinda... transformation thing? Love it! You know I'm into all sorts of weird shit. Take me on this weird sexy adventure, I am Down to Clown.

All I'm asking here is a bit of leeway. Keep a little bit of my good ol' dashing handsome ass self in the mix. I'm already riddled with those cancer shit, don't take me back to the acne and social awkwardness. If I'm a girl, make me fine. Oh, fine and aware. I'm not gonna be having any fun if I think I'm Wanda, right?

Those two things. That's all I'm asking here. Hot as hell. And still Wade in the brain. C'mon, you wouldn't have clicked on this one if you didn't love Wade Wilson, right? Whaddya say?"

11313211222122.content:
...But there was nothing there, just a throbbing pain behind her eyes, forcing her to remove her glasses and give them a slow, soft rub with her dainty hands.

"Ugh, another headache. Maybe I should take a break..." Donna muttered to herself, holding her head in her hands and doing her best to ease the headache by rubbing her temples. It was true, Donna had been crunching the books hard in order to impress Ms. Foster, the science professor at the school. Most of it was just the need for pure academic success, impress the teacher, get a good letter of reference and possibly even some intern opportunities, but a part of Donna, a secret hidden part, knew that she was attracted to her favorite teacher. Which was strange, because she knew that otherwise, she was as straight as an arrow, men, particularly muscled ones, excited her, but there was something about Ms. Foster that she couldn't help but think about late at night in her dorm room.

"The dorm sounds pretty good right about now" The bookworm muttered to herself and she slowly and carefully pulled herself to her feet, stabilizing herself on her cane before leaning over to gather her things. She slid her enormous notebook that was crammed full of notes into her denim backpack before stacking the three books she had been reading, two medical journals and a textbook on anatomy and biology and tucking them beneath one arm before hobbling towards the large desk that guarded the library's entrance.

There, behind the desk sat the librarian, Ms. Heimdala, a ridiculously attractive African-Scandinavian whose mixed heritage had given her a knock-out body and flowing black hair that she kept styled with a massive golden hair clip, while two huge hooped earings hung off her earlobes. Even her soft, brown eyes were flecked with gold, and showed a highly keen and watchful intelligence despite the fact that the librarian hardly ever spoke.

Today, however, was not one of those days.

"Ah, Ms. Blake. I hope you are not thinking about taking my books without checking them out first" Heimdala's voice was smooth, pleasant, but her eyes betrayed and cordial nature. They were watching Donna like a hawk as she suddenly realized that she had been headed out the door without checking the books out first!

"Oh. Uh, sorry Ms. Heimdala. I've got a headache coming on, I was just focused on getting back to my room and laying down for a bit" Donna said as she laid her books on the counter, giving the stoic librarian a small, nervous smile as she fished her library card out of her backpack.

"My condolences, but please do not make the same mistake again. I would hate to have to place you on probation over such a silly and avoidable mistake" Heimdala said as she scanned the barcodes of the books with a impossible large and somewhat old fashioned scanner. Donna stared at it for a moment and lamented how, even in such a prestigious academy such as this, the modern world didn't seem to care enough to fund teacher who arguably had one of the most important jobs in the world.

'But I can't change the world' Donna thought to herself as she signed the receipt the librarian handed to her, 'All I can hope to do is get out of here and get a good hospital job. Maybe I'll figure out a way to fix my leg..."

"And there you go, Ms. Blake" Heimdala said as she took the receipt from Donna and placed it within a lockbox next to her computer monitor. "Make sure that you return these by next week. I will know if you did not. I know of every book that has been taken from my library, and I know where they are at at all times. I WILL come find you and make you pay a late fee"

Donna gulped at the thought of Heimdala stalking through the hallways of the academy, searching for Donna and leaping on the somewhat crippled girl like a tiger, "Uh, yes ma'am!" And with that, Donna gathered her books and make her way slowly back to her dorm.

Neither of the two changed Asgardians noticed the invisible trickster god laughing at his own antics, though Heimdala did give the library a slow, piercing scan before going back to her paperwork.

"Goodbye, 'brother!" Loki laughed as he moved on to witness the change of another Avenger.

11433112222211.content:
Thirty minutes later a majority of the staff and faculty and student body were gathered at the pool. The 12 foot 3500 lb. Colossus was busy grilling burgers on his grill. Everyone gathered at the pool were talking, eating a burger or swimming.

"Hey Dad, mind if I take over while you eat? Everyone has already gotten a burger or two already," Laura said.

James finishes grilling one last burger before handing his spatula to Laura.

"Go ahead. Remember what I taught you about using this grill. If you break it you owe me a new one. I had this grill specially ordered to cook for parties and for those families reunions that we hold every two years," Colossus replied to his daughter.

"I understand Dad. I'm almost eighteen. You don't have to keep treating me like a child."

Colosuss smiles at his daughter. "I know, but you still have a long way to grow. You won't be adult sized until your mid-twenties. After that you'll gradually grow larger like me every fifty years or so.

"Dad, you already told me this when my mutation occurred."

"I was just reminding you just in case you forgot."

James then takes all of the burgers he grilled and grabs a gallon of lemonade. He then sits by Legion, Icewoman, Legion, Marvel Girl, Marvel Warrior, and Titanica.

"What's up guys? Anyone have any ideas when Professor X is going to talk about the intruder who stopped by earlier?"

"There was an intruder? That explains that strange light that hit us in the Danger Room earlier," Jean said.

"Apparently the name of intruder is Madam Elise Bendore. She's a reality altering mutant from the future. We should be coming up with a plan to stop her and force her to return reality back to normal," Nathaniel said.

"For crying out loud Nate! Everything is normal! One more peep about how this Madam Bendore changed reality and I will personally freeze your mouth shut!" Anna Marie yelled.

"Too bad that won't work. I can copy any super power that I see or that is used against me. I'm also a telepath and can simply teleport out of range," Nathaniel replied.

"Nathaniel how many times do I have to tell you to stop telling people about your dreams. People don't have to hear about your imaginary adventures from your dreams," Jean replied.

"Mother, I'm telling you the truth. We used to all be different at one point. I used to be a time traveler suffering from a techno organic virus and hung out with a guy named Deadpool who used to break the fourth wall."

"Not that story again. There is no such thing as a Deadpool, kid. Listen to your mother and stop blurting out this nonsense," James replied.

"I'm not making this up. Even Hank knows that something isn't right here."

"Get out of my mind Nate! I hate it when you undo my psychic shields!" Hank yelled.

Before Jean could rebuke her clone son any further Professor X and Starcat took center stage.

"It is settled. We shall go to war against Madam Bendore. Whether she is a mutant or Inhuman doesn't matter. She is still a threat to all mutant kind. Take some time to form teams. Tomorrow we will set out to stop Madam Bendore at all costs," Starcat said.

After that the X-Men talk among themselves.

"So does this thing happen all the time? I'm Madison Terris aka Titanica."

"So you're a new professor here? I'm James Howlett aka Colossus."

"I've heard of you. You're that famous wrestler form Super Smackdown, the wrestling division for people with superpowers. I'm a huge fan. I would like to have signed up, but I was too late for the season," Madison said.

"Don't sweat it. Sign ups for the next season for new wrestlers starts soon. A large powerful woman such as yourself could definitely do well in such a sport."

"Who knew you could be so sweet," Madison replied.

James begins blushing at Madison's comment.

The four of us should be good, but maybe we can get some extra assistance. Aren't Nathaniel Summers and Laura Howlett the top of their graduating class? Maybe adding them to our team would be good. Having another strong woman and a guy that can copy any power he sees would be good. As my father says a good defense is a powerful offense," Titanica said.

For the rest of the time the X-Men take their time getting into teams. Most of the original X-Men form a team with Angel and Kitty Pride. Ororo of Atlantis and Ms. Wild for a team with the senior class of students. Both Nathaniel Summers and Laura Howlett agree to join Colossus's team.

11433112222211121.content:
The next day Colossus and his team board the Blackbird, one of three planes that the X-Men use. After everyone boards Colossus gives a briefing of the mission.

"Listen up. According to our mission, Madam Elise Bendore has been spotted in an old abandoned lab in Arizona," Colossus said,

"Old lab? Are you speaking about that old Essex laboratory? Believe it or not I am the clone son of Jean Grey and Scott Summers. Ms. Sinister created me to be the ultimate weapon. By age four years ago I escaped the facility and sought out the X-Men. My mother and father were shocked to discover my existence. Yet I'm sure some of you already know this, but I'm telling those who are new about how I came into being," Marvel Warrior said.

"Are you trying to use your origin story to subtly break the "fourth wall" Nate? How many times do I have to tell you to cut it out?" Icewoman asked.

"I dunno. Maybe I am or maybe I'm not."

Before anyone else could speak the Blackbird suddenly began take off.

"Guys, if we're all back here then who is piloting the Blackbird?" Elf asked.

Everyone except Marvel Warrior starts to get concerned.

"I'm currently piloting the Blackbird. You guys have just been talking to an astral projection. Now let's get ready to rock'n'roll as we head to the old Essex lab in Arizona!"

All of a sudden rock'n'roll music begins to play. Marvel Warrior creates a sound shield to blockade the door to the cockpit.

"When did Nate learn to pilot a plane!" Elf yelled over the music.

"I don't know! He probably uses one of the many powers that he copied to create a double of himself and sneak out at night!" Laura aka Giganta yelled.

"Well, if that kid doesn't try to kill everyone we may as well suit up!" Titanica yelled.

"Good idea! Ladies suit up here while us men suit up in the back!" Colossus yelled.

"Agreed! Yet, I'm already in my suit!" Marvel Warrior responded.

In a flash of light Marvel Warrior's projection changes appearance. Apparently Marvel Warrior was wearing a black and white jump suit with X's on his belt and chest. The other members of Nathaniel's team grumble amongst themselves as they get ready to suit up.

While everyone is getting ready Marvel Warrior continues piloting the Blackbird.

"I never thought I would say this, but being a teenager again rocks! Yet, this isn't the normal main reality though which sucks. I'll be perfectly fine if we're not able to change things back to normal. I know you readers may call me a hypocrite, but who wants to worry about turning into a mindless and soulless android every waking minute of their life? Besides, I've never have had this much fun in a long time.

The rock'n'roll music stops as a notification tells Marve Warrior that the team has arrived at their destination.

"That was quick. Hopefully everyone is ready? We are about to land."

114331122222111213.content:
Without warning the Blackbird is hit by a laser. The strangest thing is that the Blackbird's warning system failed to recognize that the lab was armed.

"Dammit! The engine was hit! This is going to be a bumpy landing!' Marvel Warrior yelled.

"Nathaniel! What the hell was that! Are you trying to crash this plane!" Colossus yelled.

"We just got hit by a laser, James. It's going to be a rough landing big guy. I'm going to have to use my telepathy to land this thing," Marvel Warrior replied.

"Just do it already!" Colossus replied.

"Yes sir!"

Marvel Warrior uses his psychic powers to slow the Blackbird's descent. While Marvel Warrior was doing that the rest of the team had finished changing into their costumes. Elf was dressed in a red and black jumpsuit adorned with a white belt. Icewoman wore a blue suit with a short white cloak. Titanica wore a green shirt and black pants. She also had a black mask on as well. Colossus's daughter, Giganta wore black singlet that clung to her fat and muscular frame. Finally, Colossus was wearing a black singlet with yellow stripes. He also had on a pair of gauntlets on his meaty wrists.

"Well, whatever Nathaniel is doing is working. Not all of us are immortal or can teleport," Icewoman said.

"Nathaniel may be crazy, but he's pretty smart. Last week in science class he was able to create some perfume," Giganta said.

"That's why you smelt like chocolate and roses the other day," Colossus replied.

The Blackbird begins to jolt. Everyone braces themselves for impact. The Blackbird lands with a loud thud. Marvel Warrior emerges from the cockpit.

"Is everyone alright?" Marvel Warrior asked.

"We're fine. What was that all about? Most people like the X-Men. Why would anyone shoot at us?" Warren asked.

"I guess you guys never heard of Ms. Sinister. Her real name is Wanda Maximoff. She's a human scientist who gave herself powers by making a deal with the High Evolutionary or that's what she told me when I was born. She is not to be taken lightly. She has been illegally experimenting on humans for a long time. Some of those videos where she unleashed a gamma bomb are horrifying," Marvel Warrior said.

"Maximoff, eh? I've heard the name before. Not the same as this Wanda Maximoff, but still it amazes me that these mad scientists are related to some of history's most brilliant minds. Let's move out!" Colossus said.

"Why does she look exactly like Wanda Lashner?" Icewoman asked.

"It probably has something to do with movie rights. You see in the real world two movie studios share the film rights for Scarlet Witch and Quicksilver. Many comic readers are frustrated that our movie rights are not owned by Marvel Studios Yet Fox's recent foray into R rated films and their partnership with Marvel TV has breathed new life into our franchise," Marvel Warrior replied.

Before Marvel Warrior could reply a huge hulking figure dressed in black appeared. He also wore a white mask.

"Is that it? This guy is barely my size," Giganta scoffed.

"You think you could mock me girl. Do not understand the Deadpool!"

Deadpool presses a button on his suit. In a matter of minutes he grows to gigantic proportions.

"Just great. We're dealing with a guy that can change his size. This could be a problem," Titanica said.

Colossus and his team take on Deadpool, but they struggle against the giant as he shrugs off their attacks.

Looks like it's time to learn a new power set. I could copy Deadpool and use his power against him, but I already have the abilities of changing my size and energy resistance. I need to be unstoppable and unmovable. I'll copy Colossus's powers. I just hope there are no side effects though.

1151.title: The Incredible Hulk

11511.content:
The experiment had been prepared carefully. Every step was accounted for. Whatever the result, the safety of the gamma experiment was assured.

And then Bruce Banner spotted the teenager on the middle of the field.

"Call it off! There's someone out there!"

"What?!" screamed a voice back from the walkie talkie. "It's too late now! There's no way to stop it! They're gonna be-"

Bruce didn't bother listening to the rest. There was no time. He raced out onto the test site, signaling to the boy." Quickly! You can't be there!"

By this point, young Rick Jones realized his mistake driving onto the military facility. He raced toward the figure of Bruce Banner, desperate to reach safety from whatever was about to go off.

"What's going- Oof!" Banner quickly pushed Jones into the tent before the kid could say another word. Another second and that kid could've been-

Bruce Banner didn't even have time to finish the thought. The gamma bomb went off and pain coursed through his body.
-------------
It was a miracle, said the doctors. By all accounts, Bruce Banner should be dead. Yet he managed to escape the blast with only a few injuries.

Rick Jones was, of course, interrogated for hours and issued a fine of $1,000 for his behavior. For his part, he was all too willing to pay.

"Hey, uh, can I give you a ride home?"

Bruce raised an eyebrow at the teen. He'd usually get a ride from a coworker before reaching the bus stop, but he hadn't expected Rick Jones to offer a hand.

"You don't need to worry about that, Rick. I'm alright."

The teen rubbed the back of his neck sheepishly. "Feels like I owe you after all that."

He wasn't a bad kid, really. Just one that made big mistakes. "No one died, so there was no harm done. You just need to be more careful in the future. Get some rest."

Rick nodded hesitantly. "You too man"

Bruce had to admit, sleep was exactly what he wanted after today. Before long, he had reached home and crashed into his bed without any trouble.

Little did Bruce Banner expect to encounter an unusual predicament! The gamma radiation coursing through his veins were beginning the first of many strange alterations that Bruce Banner would experience.
11511.title: The original accident has a different result

115111.content:
Bruce Banner woke up with a start. Something was wrong.

His entire body ached in words he couldn't describe. Forces from inside his body seemed to be pushing against his skin, desperate to fill a mold that his body couldn't maintain. He struggled to his feet, only to immediately fall back on the bed in pain. His own body was fighting against him, trying to fix some problem that he could never solve on his own. The gamma radiation needed his body to be different and it wouldn't allow this unacceptable form to last.

1151111.content:
It was beyond pain. It was whole new level of sensation that Bruce had never experienced before. His muscles were expanding past his fragile frame. His hair was stretching like silly putty down his shoulders. He could feel important parts of him getting subsumed in his pants as his body growth continued. The pain was overwhelming.

...yet erotic.

Bruce couldn't explain it as he contorted on his bed. But these sensations were driving him absolutely wild. A high-pitched moan escaped his lips. "Ohhhhh mama..."

His skin was changing, his mass growing, his sex altering, but all Bruce could do was stroke himself, gasping in delight. This was incredible!

Hair stopped at his hips and his chest stopped growing once it was appropriately proportionate to this hourglass shape he'd gained. Bruce began to feel exhausted from this adventure and let his mind rest...

Hulk was all too happy to pick up the slack.

She sprang out of bed and began her strut to the mirror. Every movement was different from the way Brucr had moved. The Hulk liked it. It was just the right way a stunning body like her should operate. She didn't quite know what she looked like, but she had a feeling it was gorgeous.

Reaching the mirror, she wasn't disappointed. An Amazonian beauty, with looks and strength combined into one stunning package. She dragged her hands from her hips to her chest, feeling the curves for herself.

"Look at you!" a sassy voice said from her lips. "You're one hulking mass of gorgeousness. Brucie will be so sad to know he missed meeting me."

The Hulk struggles to remember who that Bruce was. He was some kind of scientist, running some kind of experiment. The specifics eluded her, but she knew that whatever he and Rick Jones did led to the creation of the amazing She-Hulk she had become.

"I'll have to thank him later," she muttered to herself, with a flirtatious tone. She wondered how that cute, mousy little man would appreciate her way of thanking people. Granted, she wasn't one hundred percent sure of the answer to that herself. After all, she was new to this world. Whoever she was before hadn't left any information on what she did in her free time.

She grinned at her reflection, tossing back her hair. "Maybe it's time we figured out who we are, huh?"

Of course, she'd need new clothes. She ripped these pajamas the old her had been wearing. Speaking of, the old her needed better taste. These weren't flattering at all!

Although, really, almost anything was flattering to her body. Maybe she should go find Bruce, Rick Jones, or some other handsome gentleman to figure out what kind of girl she really was...

11533211.content:
Frank Castle tried not to concern himself with the superpowered freaks of this world. They were unavoidable in many respects. If his patrols came too close to a college campus or Queens, he'd soon be forced to hear more of that web-slingers dumb quips. Teaming up with the Daredevil was inevitable if his hunt took him to Hell'a Kitchen. The people higher up the totem pole? Not his problem. He focused his efforts on the little guys, the scumbags insecure about their position in the criminal world and ready to take it out on innocents. The drug dealer and murderers and all those in-between. They were his targets.

Nonetheless, you had to be prepared. He'd be an agent for angels once, for as long as that lasted, as well as dealt with the likes of Dr. Strange and the X-Men. You picked up information.

And today, Frank's gut told him something was off.

He couldn't quite pin down what it was. There was a tension in the air, a bizarre energy following him around. His body felt as strong as ever. He didn't feel weaker or like he should abandon his hunt. He just knew something was wrong.

It didn't sit right with him. But until he figured it out, he needed to focus on his stakeout. These mobsters didn't know he was onto them and he needed to keep it that way.

121212211.content:
A soft groan slipped from his lips. Quickly he silenced himself, he tried to organise his jangling head. With his eyes closed, it still felt like the room was spinning. But he knew he was flat on his back. Experimentally he flexed his fingers, he felt a grip in one hand, more cautiously, more sensitively, he worked out it was a pistol.

It triggered another memory. He snorted, as he lay there, his nostrils flaring slightly, quietly. He'd been fighting Harley Quinn. He listened intently once more, for footsteps, for breathing, for manic laughter. But there was nothing louder than his own soft breaths.

Breathing shallowly, so it wouldn't show, Bruce felt the room stop spinning, his balance returning, as the floor stopped moving beneath his back. It was time to make a move.

In one swift, athletic leap, he flexed, and leaped into a low combat crouch. Before rising higher, straightening up, the gun at the end of his extended arm sweeping the room for dangers.

A number of things hit him in rapid succession. Each one more unsettling than the last.

The gun felt heavier than it should.... was he suffering from an injury a weakness, he hadn't realised. He tensed his muscles, holding it steady, unwilling to show vulnerability to any potential enemy.

Looking down his arms, they looked wrong... His familiar bat-armour stripped away, again a feeling of peril tweaking his sense of calm.

His whole body, just didn't feel right, not as strong. Oddly, both more flexible, and yet, somehow more ... not flabby ... but with a certain excess to his flesh. He looked fine.

He looked fine.

It took him a moment, to realise he'd spotted his own still prone body slumped on the floor. His feet scuffed, and scrapped over the floor as he stopped scanning the room. Turning his attention instead closer to home, to... to ... his body.

Except it wasn't his body... Undeniably it was her body... a woman's body.

The patterned scarlet and black bodysuit, clung to her curves, the clown princess' body clear beneath every clinging inch of fabric. Her chest rose and fell rhythmically, as Bruce caught ?her? breath. The outfit leaving her in no doubt about her current sex. The shifting weight of her bust, a constant reminder. A distraction, she could barely afford, even the teasing spandex teasing her nipples. Just the awareness, driving her pulsing blood harder, faster. She saw in horror as her nips stiffened, revealing themselves through the fabric of her top, outlined in intimate detail.

The rest of her outfit, ... her camel-toe.... HER camel-toe...

She felt the world spin around her, as she fought to catch up with the revelations. Hunkering lower, as if that reduced profile, made her less of a target, and somehow less of a woman. She found instead, the shifting invasion in her crack.

As she crouched lower, she felt the presence of a thong. Invading deeper between her plush, fulsome arse cheeks.

Harley woke, as the rain fell on her face. A giggle spilling from her lips. She tingled from head to toe, she'd never been struck by lightning before, and her whole body still felt ... off. A little distant, and unfamiliar. It felt ... Her hands roamed over her form. Dull, her fingers found heavy armour, rather than her favourite catsuit.

She tried again, but the armour was real. It wasn't some dull insensitivity in her fingers. 'Weird', she thought, a giggle slipping loose once more. But now she was more awake, more alert, more focused. The giggle .... her giggle was wrong. More throaty, deeper, ... masculine?

Her hands leaped to her chest. Her fingers tracing the outline of a stylised bat embossed onto the armour. A smile spread across her face, as she drank in more and more sensations. She felt more powerful, muscular. She felt the mask around her face, she felt her...

Well,... Batman was a man after all. And now so was she... so was he.

Snapping upright, she sat there and looked over to her former body. Her chest moving as she breathed, the swell of her thigh, so soft and round, leading to that perfect ass.

Tilting her head, she appreciated her body for the first time, as an outsider. The appeal of her curves... They weren't too full, too soft.

Instead, they were perfect.

A low, filthy chuckle came from Batman's mouth, as he looked over the still unconscious form of Harley Quinn. He allowed the laughter to fade, as he heard her moan softly, as she rolled on the floor. Popping open the pockets of the utility belt, she found the first item she wanted.

With a quick squirt of gas in her former face, he heard the gagging cough, followed by deeper breathing. She wasn't going to be waking for the next hour at least. Free to examine her own (former) bag of tricks, she found some of her own concoctions, and some from Mista' J.

The next concoction was one she'd been threatened with herself. Her joyful enthusiasm, not always appreciated. A couple of these drops, and she listened to the whistling snore, fade. Her throat tightening, and robbing her of a voice above a rasping whisper.

The walls flashed red and blue, as the police arrived. Entering the building weapons drawn, they advanced until they found the sleeping body of Harley Quinn. High in the steel rafters of the building the real Harley watched as her body was cuffed, gagged, and taken away. A special order ensured a high priority call to Arkham, and a van specially equipped for Maid of Mischief was summoned.

Under close watch, her cuffs were replaced with a straitjacket, and she left with a siren and a police escort. A non-stop journey back into care and confinement.
