12121221221.content:
Snapping upright, she woke in a cell. It only took a moment to recognise the padded walls, and bare furniture that she associated with all the fine rooms of the Arkham Asylum.

Her head still spun, sitting there, she let her jumbled memories try to find some kind of coherence. As her mind worked, her body did too. Twisting and contorting, her flexibility allowed her to slip free from the straitjacket. It landed with a stiff whuff, as the leather and canvas hit the floor.

It was coming back to her, a fight with Batman... and herself. And....

And then... she woke up back here.

Her irrepressible energy, had her leap from the bed, to pirouette on the spot. Her agility and flexibility against Batman's brute strength. Running her hands over her catsuit clad body, she checked for bumps, bruises, and any other damage. A pride in her toned, and tuned physique swelled in her heart, as her chest swelled as she took a deep cautious breath.

A catch in her throat, reminded her of her thirst. She bellowed for a guard... Or rather tried to, her voice a soft, hoarse whisper. Surveying the room a stainless steel sink was screwed to the wall in one corner, in another a plain stainless steel toilet.

The water quenched her thirst, but didn't return her voice. Rubbing her throat, she was surprised it didn't hurt, no punches, no crushed windpipe.

Batman was a gentleman when he fought, she giggled. Her laughter died, suddenly as a sense of unease chilled her stomach.
12121221221.title: Waking in a cell in Arkham, confused and frustr...

121212212211.content:
It was difficult to think. A haze had settled over her mind. But she could grasp certain details. Obvious things. I mean, it'd take a blind man not to see that she was Harley Quinn. She looked like Harley, so logic followed that she was Harley Quinn.

But something felt... off. She paced around the cell curiously. She had been in Arkham dozens of times, but this didn't feel like it was <i>her</i> room. Had they moved her?

A photo was on the desk, one of the few allowances from the guards. A picture of her and Poison Ivy at the carnival. She picked it up, feeling its creases. She couldn't remember this day at all, even though it had clearly been a happy one. Even Poison Ivy was smiling.

She frowned. That wasn't right. That was so... stiff. Formal, even. Analytical. She was Joker- Mr. J's girl. She had nicknames for everything and everyone. But for the life of her, she couldn't remember Ivy's.

And then there was Mr. J himself. Her... love? That sounded right. She could feel an intense need to find Mr. J within her. But she was struggling to define it. Love was mysterious like that.

She sat down again, puzzling over the gaps in her memory. Had something knocked her noggin in her fight with Bats? Or was there something more nefarious at work.

Maybe she needed to check on her pals and do some sleuthing. Gray Ghost style. That struck a cord with her. Invigorated her, even. As soon as they let her roam free, it was off to her partners in crime.

The question was: who?

1212311.content:
The alarm had gone off at 'Waynetech Labs'. The police were responding, but there was something in the Despatcher's tone of voice that made her sit forward, when she heard the fateful words, '... The Joker has been sighted in the vicinity.."

She was already racing off to her bike, mentally planning her route.

The engine throbbed powerfully between her legs, her thighs clutching tightly to the warmth of the seat, and the vibrations from the engine. She felt excitement in her veins, as her hair flew behind, and her cloak flapped in the wind. There wasn't much traffic at three in the morning, but she swept between the cars as if they were parked.

Killing the engine as she got closer, she silently glided into the dark alley opposite the labs. Despite the modern interior it was styled with seven large roman pillars at the main entrance.

"You're getting quicker." a gruff, growling voice admitted from deep in the shadows of a doorway. He stepped forward until he was almost visible, the sharp ears of his outline already confirming why her heart was racing.

"They don't get away with anything."

Determination resonated in his voice, her ... bones also harmonising with his sentiments.

"They..." she cursed the softness in her own voice.

"He's got Harley with him..." he explained.

He didn't need to tell her who had which target.

"I don't suppose..."

"No." Babs cut his question, his suggestion off. She kept her voice firm, and flat, determined, avoiding petulance. She wasn't going to step aside to let him face the danger alone.

"I can hold my own." she assured him.

He didn't answer but a hint of teeth showed beneath the mask... My God, had he just smiled.

Together they crept from the alley, using the cars for cover. Keeping low, they darted across the road to rest against the low wall.

Waynetech Labs didn't need a high wall, or an electric fence. It's defences were high-tech.

Babs considered a stiff e-mail to Bruce Wayne, before stopping herself. That wouldn't have done more than slow the joker down. Alas, it was a pristine lawn from here to the front doors. Without the slenderest sapling to provide cover.

Sharing the same concern, Batman answered with a shrug before leaping from cover to land on the grass. She followed a moment later, and the pair sprinted across. As they reached halfway across, a figure strutted out from behind one of the pillars.

A woman in skin-tight lycra, with something large and round resting on her shoulder. Stepping into the light, the red and black diamonds of her outfit were revealed. But it was the head of her hammer that she was toting. The metal of a stubby barrel caught the moon light. It looked like no weapon she'd ever seen before, with a wide... so wide muzzle but short. It looked like a sawn-off rocket launcher.

She felt the tension from Batman. He lowered into a crouch, ready to dive one way or the other.

"Morning, boys and girls. You're up bright and early."

Her gaze flicked towards the voice, as out from the shadows stepped. She spotted the same weapon, briefly a smile cracked his make-up, and he fired. Brilliant blue lightning shot from the weapon, in an instant it danced around Batman, crackling and sparking. Whatever it was, it was bypassing his armour, his teeth were gritted in pain. She turned to help him only to be struck with a second beam from a giggling Harley Quinn. Agony raced through every nerve in her body, as blinding light flared across her vision. Impossibly, the pain intensified, until a high shriek was ripped from her lungs as her agony filled the night.

Night returned as the weapons cut off. The pair were capable of nothing beyond collapsing on the spot, helplessly, they listened to a car speed away into the night.

Specks and dots danced in front of her eyes, as she tried to blink them away. Her legs refused to respond, they felt alien and distant. Every impulse wrong and resisting her.

Through watery eyes, she made out the dark outline of her companion. It wasn't really any comfort, but she felt a sense of pride that Batman too was ... just as ... incapacitated.
1212311.title: Batman

Afraid of losing clues, Babs forced herself upright, and shambled across the grass to where the manic pair had been standing. She still felt 'wrong', but put that down to the disorienting effects of whatever hit the pair of them. Her breathing was deep and rasping, with pain coming from each jarring leg shuddering pace.

His chest felt heavy, and his breathing laboured, as he lay curled up on his side. A frustrated groan burst from his lips, and he rolled onto his back. Again his chest shifted heavily, his strength sapped, it felt off, very off.

With a groan verging on a scream, he managed to land one hand, one arm with leaden weight on his chest. He needed to find out if his armour had been ripped, if he was wounded, his chest ripped open.

His breath caught, as the arm landed. It landed to a familiar softness. In his guise as a billionaire playboy, he'd felt more than a few soft, supple breasts. But this was the first time he had felt the groping in his own chest, as well as with his combat coarsened fingers.

He sat bolt upright, this time, the sloshing weight delay from his chest just confirmed what he suspected, what he knew, what he dreaded.

Looking down, he saw the yellow stylised Bat outline, as it followed the swell of his... her bosom. He somehow switched bodies with Batgirl. The sumptuous bust was framed by two cascades of long gingery, red hair, that just confirmed he was in the commissioner's daughter's body.
The taste, the alien waxy-ness on his lips was lipstick, The difficulty with her feet, had to be the heels she was wearing.

With a shudder, he realised, that SHE had to be in his body, with access to his equipment. Able to discover his identity merely by pulling off his own mask.

Blinking his vision clear, he saw the shambling outline of Batman, his cloak hiding his body, but those boots were familiar, and the moonlight gave his head a unique silhouette. Instinctively, she reached forward.

1213322121.content:
Batman stalked the criminals below him. He crouched on the rooftop, spying on the illegal exchange of drugs and bullets. Batman dropped down, ready to fight. He hit the ground.

But it was not Gotham.

Batman stood up, and surveyed his surroundings. He seemed to be near an open temple to a Greek goddess.

"Is this Theymiscara?"

Batman started to walk around. He approached the giant statue in the temple, and studied it.

"Aphrodite."

Batman took a closer look at the base, and blacked out.


When he woke up, he was out of costume. Instead, he was wearing Wonder Woman's outfit. The underwear was tight, and dug into his crotch.

Bruce rose from the ground, and found himself in the same temple as before. He started to walk, but stumbled in the high heels. He regained his balance as the first changes began.

Bruce started walking again, getting used to the high heels. He stumbles again, and the change begins. Bruce is frozen in mid -step. He hears a beautiful, seductive female voice. It echoes within his mind.

"So, a man has stepped foot on Theymiscara. Bruce Wayne, this cannot be allowed any longer.It also seems that our ambassador has gone missing."

Bruce knew what this meant. He struggled with his mystical bonds, but had no success. Bruce's scalp started to tingle. His hair started to grow. It reached his neck, messy and tangled. It continued to grow, forcing a burning sensation upon Bruce. More hair sprouted from his head, reaching his mid-back. It was still tangled, but seemed to automatically move back, brushing aside to form a beautiful, long, single stroke of hair that rested on the shoulder.

Batman paced through the Batcave, thinking. Poison Ivy had just been murdered by the Joker. Her body was dumped in the river that led to the Batcave. Could her body end up there? If so, could a trace be found? Who knew. He walked towards the Batcomputer, but was interrupted by a loud rumbling. He backed up, only to come face to face with a giant vine that sprouted from the bottom to the top of the cave. He turned around to find another one. Another. Another. Soon, Batman was surrounded. Smaller vines sprouted from the giant ones. Pollen dropped down from them.

Batman was helpless to the seeds. They dropped on him, causing a burning sensation throughout his body. The Batsuit started to become looser and smaller, before falling off and shriveling into nothing. The same went for the clothes underneath. All that was left was a pair of boxers. The pollen continued to fall, burning Bruce even more.

His hair started to lighten from black to brown. It grew shaggy. It lightened to a bright red, and grew to his neck. It became dark read, and grew to his mid-back, flowing naturally, yet perfectly.

123332111.content:
Thousands of years ago, Hippolyta, Queen of the Amazons, crafted a daughter from clay. That daughter was blessed with great power, and would come to be known as Princess Diane. For the thousands of years Diane had lived, she only knew of the island of Themyscira. But today, after so long, she would leave the island and be an envoy for her people to the rest of the world. However, that new journey came with an odd stipulation...
-----
"Princess Diane of Themyscira, you have one the tournament, and now have the right to leave our island. You have been grated tools that will aid you in your journey, plus the moniker of Wonder Woman." Queen Hippolyta said.

"Thank you mother." Diane replied. She had become a beautiful woman, mid-20's in appearance, but many, many years older.

"Before you leave, however, there is but one thing left to do." Hippolyta said, before directing Diane's attention to a very large tub. "Within this container is the clay that was used to give you form and life. You are to touch the clay. When you do, your bosom will increase in size."

Diane was confused. "Mother, what purpose would that serve?" She asked.

"Of that, I am unsure. I only know that it is required of you to do so." Hippolyta replied. "Diane, in the thousands of years I have been your mother, I have felt you were destined for something great. So please, if a larger bosom is required of you to complete your duty, then you must."

Diane nodded. "I understand." She said. "How large is my bosom to become?"

Hippolyta looked at the container. "From what I know, your bosom must become..."

info.brief_description: The superheroes and villains are ready to change!
info.description:
The characters of Marvel and DC are about to change. After the Infinity Gauntlet and Darksied's Omega Beams go awry, the two universes are forever changed. Who will change? Who will live? Will they ever find out what happened to them? And will they change back?

RULES
There can be swearing
There can be non-graphic sex
Any transformations are acceptable
Stick to the story, but it doesn't have to be explored
Death is allowed, but it must be heroic, or deserved
These are the comics, not the movies
